definition: (main) hall/large room for a specific purpose/CL:間|间[jian1]/relationship between cousins etc on the paternal side of a family/of the same clan/classifier for classes, lectures etc/classifier for sets of furniture

sentences.english: Also there is a living room where we have dinner and watch TV.
sentences.chinese: 然后是客堂，平常吃饭跟看电视。

sentences.english: Once you're in the air, it's just like sitting in your own living room.
sentences.chinese: 一升到空中你就像坐在自己家中客堂一样。

sentences.english: Our house isn't big , so we often have meals in the living room .
sentences.chinese: 我们的房子不大，所以我们经常在客堂用饭。

definition: a room in a Buddhist monastery/a temple
reception pavilion (generally part of a large residence, and often built in a garden)
Hall of Great Strength, main hall of a Buddhist temple containing the main image of veneration 大雄[da4 xiong2]
central room of a traditional Chinese house
main hall of a Buddhist temple
central building (in a traditional house)/primary wife
remote relatives (with the same family name)
courtyard/atrium/opening in a roof/skylight/caisson ceiling/(TCM) acupuncture point TB10
